content:
Instead of having about 400 errors (one per html page), as I had in the very recent past (but not before), now there is only one error with the
"The html source does not contain the header marker <!--ReleaseHeader--><p id="publish-box">Publish Box goes here</p><!--EndReleaseHeader--> (see note at http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Implementation_Guide_Publishing_Requirements#HL7_HTML_Standards_considerations)" :-)

Is anything that I can do to eliminate also the remaining one ? Thanks in advance.
@Rob Hausam was looking into what is going on with that page
Sorry I was not aware of this ... I'll wait for the Rob's fix :-)

I'll look at that today. If I'm recalling correctly I fixed the issue with "Any.html" before, so I'm not sure why it's apparently back. I think it was something with the framework, though, so maybe the previous fix was overwritten with the latest framework update. Not sure, but I will find out and get it fixed.
Add the publish box html to it is in framework folder
That page does not use a layout so needs to be manually updated.
@Eric Haas Is 'Any.html' needed for anything in particular in the framework? My inclination is to remove it (and also todo.md). If that's not the right thing to do that would be helpful to know.
Any.html is needed in the framework for Reference(Any). todo.md can be removed I sse that to stub in pages.
